period. It is expressed per 1,000 births. Stillbirths 
are divided into two categories, macerated 
or fresh, on the basis of their appearance. 
Macerated stillbirths are typically those that 
die before labor begins. Fresh stillbirths are 
those that die intrapartum (during childbirth). 
Although not all stillbirths can be 
prevented, those that occur during labor 
and delivery are often related to the 
quality of delivery care and are largely 
preventable. High-quality obstetric care
